subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






May 2, 2007


                              		
                              		
                              	  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video



                              	
                              	  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation






TOP STORIESHouse Bid To Override Bush Veto Fails
The Democratic-controlled House fell far short in its bid to override President Bush's veto of an Iraqi war spending bill
                        with timetables for troop withdrawals. Lawmakers went directly to the White House to talk about a compromise bill. More...Watch: Pelosi: The President Is Wrong
• Train Carrying NASA Boosters Derails• Accused Daughter Rapist Held In Hong Kong• FDA Seeks New Antidepressant WarningU.S.Halberstam Crash Driver: I Had Green Light
A 64-year-old man whose car was involved in the accident that killed Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist David Halberstam claims
                        he had the green light at the time of the crash. More...Watch: Notebook: David Halberstam
• Train Carrying NASA Boosters Derails• Immigration Protest In L.A. Turns Ugly
                     					| Watch• Study On Race Calls Foul On NBA Referees• More StoriesWorldIsraeli Foreign Minister To PM: Step Down
Tzipi Livni, Israel's popular foreign minister, says Prime Minister Ehud Olmert's resignation would be "the right thing to
                        do." She could succeed Olmert if he steps aside. Olmert says rivals should "slow down."  More...
• Tiny Caribbean Nation Feels China's Wrath• Swedish Companies Acknowledge Diversity• 4,000 U.S. Troops Headed To Baghdad • More StoriesPoliticsSounding Like Reagan Not Easy For GOP
The war in Iraq has left the GOP feeling gloomy and pessimistic about it's future, making it difficult for any of the party's
                        presidential hopefuls to express the upbeat optimism Ronald Reagan was known for, The Politico reports. More...Watch: GOP Alternative Wanted
• House Bid To Override Bush Veto Fails
                     					| Watch• Feeling Safe Isn't Safe
                     					| Watch• Senate Skeptical Over Revised Spying Rules• More StoriesHealthCandy-Flavored Meth Targets New Users
Meth makers are combining the illicit drug Methamphetamine with sweet drinks, lollipops and more to mask its normally bitter
                        taste and entice first-time users. "Strawberry Quick," as it's called, has been found in several states. More...
• FDA: Tainted Feed Is Low Risk To Humans• Passive Smoke Boosts Dementia Risk• FDA Seeks New Antidepressant Warning• More StoriesSciTechAustralia Working On Beer Power
Scientists and Australian beermaker Foster's are teaming up to generate clean energy from brewery waste water by using sugar-consuming
                        bacteria. More...
• Car-Free Zones On Rise In U.S.• NASA Ponders Death, Sex On Mars Mission• X-Rated Internet Addiction
                     					| Watch• More StoriesBusinessMurdoch's Dow Jones Bid Is Marketing Coup
With the news of a dramatic, unsolicited bid to acquire Dow Jones & Co. for $60 a share, Rupert Murdoch has created a tremendous
                        amount of excitement, MarketWatch's Jon Friedman notes. More...Watch: Murdoch Bids For Dow Jones
• Media Magnate Murdoch Faces Dow Battle• WSJ's Take On Rupert Murdoch
                     					| Watch• Auto Sales Take Nosedive In April• More StoriesEntertainmentBritney Back On Stage
Britney Spears has made her comeback. The rehabbed pop princess took the stage for a five-song set at San Diego's House of
                        Blues in what is thought to be her first concert in nearly three years. More...Watch: Britney's Comeback Performance
• Japanese Audiences Warned About "Babel"
                     					| Watch• MTV Takes Its VMA Awards Bash To Sin City
                     					| Watch• Bush Thanks "Idol" Viewers• More StoriesOpinionReid Misplays His Hand
True or not, Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid made a grave mistake when he said "this war is lost," and ended up defending
                        himself when he could have shifted the debate to President Bush's responsibility for the fiasco, says The New Republic. More...Watch: War Bill Sent To President
• Bush Thwarts Bid To Short-Change War
                     					| Watch• Is 60 The New 40 Or Is 40 The New 60?• Republicans For Hillary?
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Tracy Smith: Bipolar Disorder Plagues A Child's Life
Haley Abaspour looks like a normal 11-year-old girl, but she suffers from a multitude of mental problems, the most severe
                        being bipolar disorder.  More...Watch: Treating Bipolar Kids
• EARLY SHOW: Beware Of Fake Drugs Online, FDA Warns

Britney's Comeback PerformanceShowBuzz RAW: Britney Spears made her comeback performance at the House of Blues in California, singing some of her
                                    earliest songs. Her performance reportedly lasted less than 15 minutes.
